tit.j: 山本礼三郎プロダクション

sen.j: 山本礼三郎プロダクション（やまもとれいさぶろう-、1928年6月 設立 - 8月 解散）は、かつて京都に存在した映画会社である。
sen.e: Yamamoto Reizaburo Production (established in June 1928 and dissolved in August) is a film company which existed in Kyoto.
Yamamoto Reizaburo Productions (established in June 1928 and dissolved in August) was a film company located in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Production > Productions; is > was; which existed > located
sen.e: Yamamoto Reizaburo Productions (established in June 1928 and dissolved in August) was a film company located in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: マキノ・プロダクションの俳優山本礼三郎が設立したスタープロダクションであり、貸しスタジオの双ヶ丘撮影所で1本のサイレント映画を製作した。
sen.e: It was a star production established by Reizaburo YAMAMOTO, an actor belonging to Makino Production, and it produced one silent movie in Narabigaoka Studio, a studio for rent.
It was established by Reizaburo YAMAMOTO, an actor who belonged to Makino Productions, and produced one silent film in the rentable Narabigaoka Studio.
sen.cmt: eliminated "star production" since this carries no meaning for me in English; Production > Productions; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: It was established by Reizaburo YAMAMOTO, an actor who belonged to Makino Productions, and produced one silent film in the rentable Narabigaoka Studio.

sen.j: 1927年（昭和2年）4月の『鞍馬天狗異聞 角兵衛獅子』以来、近藤勇役が板についた山本礼三郎であったが、マキノで25作の出演作を数えた1928年（昭和3年）5月に同社を退社、設立したのがこの「山本礼三郎プロダクション」（山本プロ）である。
sen.e: Reizaburo YAMAMOTO, having become quite at home as Isami KONDO since "Kuramatengu-ibun Kakubeejishi" in April 1927, left Makino in May 1928 after acting in twenty-five movies there and established this "Yamamoto Reizaburo Production" (Yamamoto Pro).

Reizaburo YAMAMOTO, having become quite at home in his role as Isami KONDO from the April 1927 production of "Kuramatengu-ibun Kakubeejishi," left Makino in May of 1928 after acting in twenty-five films and established "Yamamoto Reizaburo Productions" (Yamamoto Pro).
sen.cmt: home as Isami > at home in his role as Isami;

sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: そもそも、同年4月、当時マキノの四国ブロック配給を行っていた三共社の山崎徳次郎が、阪東妻三郎プロダクションの経営者・立花良介と計画し、従来から映画作家のインディペンデント系作品を手がけていた神戸市の菊水キネマ商会の大島菊松を中心とした全国150館の独立系映画館主に呼びかけ、大阪に「日本活動常設館館主連盟映画配給本社」を設立、独立プロダクションへの製作費の出資と作品の直接公開の方針を打ち出したことがきっかけであった。
sen.e: Originally, as prelude to this establishment, in April 1928 Tokujiro YAMAZAKI of Sankyo Company, which distributed Makino's movies in the Shikoku block in those days, conspired with Ryosuke TACHIBANA, the top executive of Bando Tsumasaburo Production, to ask one hundred and fifty independent theater owners throughout Japan including Kikumatsu OSHIMA of Kikusui Kinema Firm in Kobe City, which had dealt with independent works by moviemakers, to cooperate in establishment of "Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha" (Headquarters of Eiga Haikyu for association of masters of movie theaters in Japan) in Osaka and declared their policy of direct release of movies as well as funding for production cost of independent productions.

As prelude to this establishment, in April of 1928 Tokujiro YAMAZAKI of Sankyo, which had been distributing Makino's films in the Shikoku area, conspired with the top executive of Bando Tsumasaburo Productions named Ryosuke TACHIBANA to ask 150 independent theater owners throughout Japan, such as Kikumatsu OSHIMA of Kikusui Kinema in Kobe that had dealt with independent works by moviemakers, to cooperate in establishing "Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha" (Distribution Company Headquarters for Movie Theater Owners in Japan) (also known as "Kanshu Renmei" [the Theater Owner's Association]) in Osaka and declaring policies of the direct release of movies as well as funding for production costs of independent productions.

sen.e: As prelude to this establishment, in April of 1928 Tokujiro YAMAZAKI of Sankyo, which had been distributing Makino's films in the Shikoku area, conspired with the top executive of Bando Tsumasaburo Productions named Ryosuke TACHIBANA to ask 150 independent theater owners throughout Japan, such as Kikumatsu OSHIMA of Kikusui Kinema in Kobe that had dealt with independent works by moviemakers, to cooperate in establishing 'Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha' (Distribution Company Headquarters for Movie Theater Owners in Japan) (also known as "Kanshu Renmei" [the Theater Owner's Association]) in Osaka and declaring policies of the direct release of movies as well as funding for production costs of independent productions.
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: マキノと契約更新で紛糾した片岡千恵蔵が4月にマキノを退社、5月に「片岡千恵蔵プロダクション」（千恵プロ）を設立、さらに、山崎の呼びかけに共鳴したマキノ御室撮影所の大道具主任河合広始と撮影技師の田中十三もマキノを退社、京都・双ヶ丘に貸しスタジオ「日本キネマ撮影所」（双ヶ丘撮影所）を設立した。
sen.e: Chiezo KATAOKA, having had trouble with Makino over renewal of the contract, left Makino in April and established "Kataoka Chiezo Production" (Chie Pro) in May while Hiroshi KAWAI, chief stage setting engineer of Makino, and Juzo TANAKA, a cameraman, also left Makino in sympathy with YAMAZAKI's demands and established "Japan Cinema Studio" (Narabigaoka Studio), a studio for rent in Narabigaoka, Kyoto.

Chiezo KATAOKA, having had trouble with Makino over renewal of his contract, left Makino in April and established "Kataoka Chiezo Productions" (Chie Pro) in May while Makino Productions' chief stagehand Hiroshi KAWAI and cameraman Juzo TANAKA also left Makino inspired by YAMAZAKI and established the studio-for-rent "Japan Cinema Studio" (Narabigaoka Studio) in Narabigaoka, Kyoto.

sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 片岡と同時期に嵐寛寿郎、中根龍太郎、山口俊雄 (新派俳優)、市川小文治らはそれぞれ自らのプロダクションを設立、山本の「山本プロ」とともに「日本映画プロダクション連盟」を結成し、河合・田中の「双ヶ丘撮影所」をレンタル使用して製作、山崎らの「館主連盟」に対する作品供給を開始した。
sen.e: Concurrently with KATAOKA, Kanjuro ARASHI, Ryutaro NAKANE, Toshio YAMAGUCHI (an actor belonging to Shinpa-Geki) and Reizaburo YAMAMOTO established their own productions, formed "Japan Movie Production Federation" with Kobunji's "Kabuki Eiga Pro" and started to supply YAMAZAKI's "Kanshu Renmei" with movies which were shot with the use of the rental "Narabigaoka Studio" operated by KAWAI and TANAKA.

Concurrently with KATAOKA, Kanjuro ARASHI, Ryutaro NAKANE, Toshio YAMAGUCHI (an actor belonging to Shinpa-Geki) and Reizaburo YAMAMOTO establishing their own productions, they formed the "Japan Movie Production Federation" with Kobunji's "Kabuki Eiga Pro" and started to supply YAMAZAKI's "Kanshu Renmei" with films that were shot using the rentable Narabigaoka Studio operated by KAWAI and TANAKA.

sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 「山本プロ」は、設立第1作として製作したのが、山本の主演作『蒼白の剣士』である。
sen.e: As its first movie, "Yamamoto Pro" produced "Sohaku no kenshi" starring YAMAMOTO.
As its first film, "Yamamoto Pro" produced "Sohaku no Kenshi" starring YAMAMOTO.

sen.j: 監督と撮影にはマキノから引き抜いた高見定衛と藤井春美をそれぞれ起用、共演には衣笠貞之助の作家系インディペンデント・プロダクション「衣笠映画連盟」の糸浦柳子（のちの桜井京子）を起用した。
sen.e: The movie was directed by Sadae TAKAMI and shot by Harumi FUJII, both of whom had been recruited away from Makino, and Ryuko ITOURA (later known as Kyoko SAKURAI), who belonged to "Kinugasa Eiga Renmei," Sadanosuke KINUGASA's writer-led independent production, was selected as a costar.

sen.j: 同作は、「市川小文治歌舞伎映画プロダクション」製作の『野崎村』、「中根龍太郎喜劇プロダクション」（中根プロ）製作の『助太刀商売』、この流れとは別に帝国キネマから独立した森本登良男の作家系インディペンデント・プロダクション「森本登良男プロダクション」の『戦鑑三笠』と4本まとめて、同年7月1日に「菊水館」を中心に公開された。
sen.e: This movie was released in theaters including "Kikusuikan" on July 1, 1928, coupled with "Nozaki-mura village" produced by "Ichikawa Kobunji Kabuki Eiga Production," "Sukedachi shobai" (business of backing up somebody) produced by "Nakane Ryutaro Comedy Production" (Nakane Pro) and "Battleship Kinugasa" by "Morimoto Torao Production," a writer-led independent production by Torao MORIMOTO, who had separated from Teikoku kinema engei kabushiki gaisha (Imperial Cinema Entertainment Co.) Ltd.) apart from the above-stated movement.

sen.j: 千恵プロと嵐寛寿郎プロダクション（寛プロ）だけが残ったが、寛プロ（第1期寛プロ）も同年内に1度解散、ただ千恵プロだけが翌年早々に嵯峨野に自前のスタジオを築いていくことになる。
sen.e: Chie Pro and Arashi Kanjuro Production (Kan Pro) survived, but Kan Pro was dissolved in 1928 once (that is why it is called The First Arashi Kanjuro Production) and only Chie Pro went on to build its own studio in Sagano early the next year.

sen.j: 解散後の山本は、マキノから寛プロが引き継いだ『鞍馬天狗』の近藤勇役を2本演じてから、監督の高見とともに東京の河合映画製作社に入社、撮影技師の藤井は寛プロを経て東亜キネマ京都撮影所へ、糸浦こと桜井は日活撮影所へ移籍した。
sen.e: After the dissolution YAMAMOTO, after playing the role of Isami KONDO in two movies of "Kurama Tengu," which Kan Pro had succeeded from Makino, joined Kawai eiga seisakusha in Tokyo with TAKAMI the director, FUJII, a cameraman, moved to Kan Pro and then to Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio, and SAKURAI, alias ITOURA, moved to Nikkatsu Studio.
